member.name: MIB_TCP6ROW_OWNER_MODULE
member.summary: The MIB_TCP6ROW_OWNER_MODULE structure contains information that describes an IPv6 TCP connection bound to a specific process ID (PID) with ownership data.

member.name: MIB_TCP6ROW_OWNER_MODULE.ucLocalAddr
member.summary: The IPv6 address for the local endpoint of the TCP connection on the local computer. A value of zero indicates the listener can accept a connection on any interface.

member.name: MIB_TCP6ROW_OWNER_MODULE.dwLocalScopeId
member.summary: The scope ID in network byte order for the local IPv6 address.

member.name: MIB_TCP6ROW_OWNER_MODULE.dwLocalPort
member.summary: The port number in network byte order for the local endpoint of the TCP connection on the local computer.

member.name: MIB_TCP6ROW_OWNER_MODULE.ucRemoteAddr
member.summary: The IPv6 address of the remote endpoint of the TCP connection on the remote computer. When the dwState member is MIB_TCP_STATE_LISTEN, this value has no meaning.

member.name: MIB_TCP6ROW_OWNER_MODULE.dwRemoteScopeId
member.summary: The scope ID in network byte order for the remote IPv6 address.

member.name: MIB_TCP6ROW_OWNER_MODULE.dwRemotePort
member.summary: The port number in network byte order for the remote endpoint of the TCP connection on the remote computer.

summary.para: The state of the TCP connection. This member can be one of the values from the MIB_TCP_STATE enumeration defined in the Tcpmib.h header file. Note that the Tcpmib.h header file is automatically included in Iprtrmib.h, which is automatically included in the Iphlpapi.h header file. The Tcpmib.h and Iprtrmib.h header files should never be used directly.

listheader.description: The TCP connection is in the CLOSED state that represents no connection state at all.
The TCP connection is in the LISTEN state waiting for a connection request from any remote TCP and port.
The TCP connection is in the SYN-SENT state waiting for a matching connection request after having sent a connection request (SYN packet).
The TCP connection is in the SYN-RECEIVED state waiting for a confirming connection request acknowledgment after having both received and sent a connection request (SYN packet).

The TCP connection is in the ESTABLISHED state that represents an open connection, data received can be delivered to the user. This is the normal state for the data transfer phase of the TCP connection.
The TCP connection is FIN-WAIT-1 state waiting for a connection termination request from the remote TCP, or an acknowledgment of the connection termination request previously sent.
The TCP connection is FIN-WAIT-1 state waiting for a connection termination request from the remote TCP.
The TCP connection is in the CLOSE-WAIT state waiting for a connection termination request from the local user.
The TCP connection is in the CLOSING state waiting for a connection termination request acknowledgment from the remote TCP.

The TCP connection is in the LAST-ACK state waiting for an acknowledgment of the connection termination request previously sent to the remote TCP (which includes an acknowledgment of its connection termination request).
The TCP connection is in the TIME-WAIT state waiting for enough time to pass to be sure the remote TCP received the acknowledgment of its connection termination request.
The TCP connection is in the delete TCB state that represents the deletion of the Transmission Control Block (TCB), a data structure used to maintain information on each TCP entry.

member.name: MIB_TCP6ROW_OWNER_MODULE.dwOwningPid
member.summary: The PID of the local process that issued a context bind for this TCP connection.

member.name: MIB_TCP6ROW_OWNER_MODULE.liCreateTimestamp
member.summary: A structure that indicates when the context bind operation that created this TCP connection occurred.

member.name: MIB_TCP6ROW_OWNER_MODULE.OwningModuleInfo
member.summary: An array of opaque data that contains ownership information.
